intro: Bartsia patens, commonly known as the lesser bartsia, is a small herbaceous plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded woodlands and has opposite, ovate leaves with serrated edges. Its flowers are small, tubular, and usually pink or white, arranged in clusters at the base of the plant. Bartsia patens is characterized by its ability to form dense mats and its reliance on mycorrhizal associations for nutrient uptake.
